page.title: 18MRS.SMITH-PEARCE WILDHERN
page.content: Mrs.Smith-Pearce was born in 1893 and spent many years in India where she remembers shooting a panther and finishing off a wounded tiger.She moved to Wildhern in 1963 after living for many years at Tangley House.She firmly believes that modern houses should all face south so that they could receive the maximum amount of sunlight.The local bus service enables her to shop in Andover once a week and she thinks that daily gardening helps to keep her so fit.Her other main interest is sewing which she sells to raise money for an orphanage in Bangladesh.She finds few problems for the old living in a village but is nervous about leaving the house when she shops or attends church or when she hears odd noises at night but she would prefer her house to be a little further away from her neighbours.
